prompt: Facts: The deceased, Pandiselvi, married the appellant, T. Manikadan, on 06.09.2006.; At the time of marriage, the deceased's family gave 7 sovereigns of gold jewellery, household articles, and Rs.10,000/- cash.; Prosecution alleged that after the marriage, the appellant demanded an additional Rs.50,000/- cash and 10 sovereigns of gold jewellery as dowry.; Allegations included that the appellant frequently harassed and abused the deceased, both physically and mentally, due to non-fulfillment of these demands.; PW1 (deceased's mother) testified about the demands made before and after marriage, and the subsequent harassment.; PW4 (deceased's paternal uncle) corroborated PW1's testimony regarding dowry demands and harassment.; On 17.03.2007, within about 6 months of marriage, Pandiselvi was found dead by hanging in the matrimonial home.; The death occurred under unnatural circumstances within 7 years of marriage.; An FIR was registered based on the complaint by PW1.; Post-mortem examination (conducted by PW2, Dr. Shanthi) confirmed the cause of death as 'asphyxia due to hanging'.; The Trial Court (Mahila Court, Madurai) convicted the appellant under Sections 498A and 304B IPC and sentenced him to 2 years RI for 498A and 7 years RI for 304B (minimum sentence), to run concurrently.; The appellant filed the present appeal (Crl.A.(MD) No.374 of 2008) challenging the Trial Court's judgment dated 31.07.2008. | IPC: Section 304B (Dowry Death), Section 498A (Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty), Section 113B, Indian Evidence Act (Presumption as to dowry death)
